Field Label:
Smokeless Tobacco

The next questions ask about smokeless tobacco which you put in your mouth. Frequently you chew, suck or spit while using smokeless tobacco, although there is no need to do so for some types. Snus, for instance, is a type of smokeless tobacco that comes in a small pouch that you put inside your lip.

There are many kinds of smokeless tobacco, such as snus pouches, loose snus, moist snuff, dip, spit, and chewing tobacco. Common brands include Red man®<sup>1</sup>, Levi Garrett®<sup>2</sup>, Beech-nut®<sup>3</sup>, Skoal®<sup>4</sup>, Grizzly®<sup>5</sup>, Nordic Ice®<sup>6</sup>, and Copenhagen®<sup>7</sup>.
Have you ever seen or heard of smokeless tobacco, such as snus pouches, loose snus, moist snuff, dip, spit, or chewing tobacco, before this study?
Is using smokeless tobacco less harmful, about the same, or more harmful than smoking cigarettes?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Less harmful|2, About the same|3, More harmful|-8, DON'T KNOW|-7, REFUSED

Field Label: Is using snus pouches less harmful, about the same, or more harmful than smoking cigarettes?
